intro: Psychotria capensis, commonly known as the Cape psychotria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Psychotria capensis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
